meanings.definition: The distinctive taste of a food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The strawberry ice cream had a sweet flavour.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the flavour of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The spicy flavour of the chili made my mouth tingle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter added a delightful flavour to the room.
meanings.sent5: The flavour of victory was evident in their celebratory cheers.

meanings.definition: A particular quality or characteristic that adds interest or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The old bookstore had a nostalgic flavour to it.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a suspenseful flavour that kept me on the edge of my seat.
meanings.sent3: His jokes added a humorous flavour to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The painting had a unique flavour that captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist added a surprising flavour to the story.
